reviews.text: Brunch with friends, the lobster benedict really made my day.
Tolles Essen in schÃ¶ner AtmosphÃ¤re.

When we arrived at the reservation time we were told they only have those thin tiny high top table available. There are couple empty regular tables around - front desk insisted that regular tables are only for hotel guests which I do not think is true.

good service, nice atmosphere.
TINY portions, but food was above average.

My wife and I had dinner here this past Saturday night. We were very much looking forward an adult evening out, as we had received great service from the bar the prior couple of evenings. Shortly after being seated we wound up next to two obnoxious children with very minimal parental control, there was another child yelling, which their parents found amusing, and another table with a loud child. For a nice hotel, and restaurant, possibly considering a hard cutoff for children would be nice to avoid a spoiled meal over loud children.   Table service was ok, would have liked it to be more elevated.

Sat to buy for about five minutes, waiting for a drink, because the bartender was busy serving other clients, Which was not the issue. My issue is that another person just walked in and sat down next to me and the bartender turns to her and ask her what she wants, even though I have been sitting there, and he saw me sitting there and saw this young woman walk in. So I got up and I walked out. The restaurant and the food are expensive and itâ€™s designed to have a great atmosphere, but that is really disheartening when you were waiting to be serviced and somebody just completely ignores you to talk to somebody else and service another client who had just walked in. Thank you so much.

This is a great spot for a business lunch. Healthy options and burgers. The space feels expansive and upscale without being too expensive. The bar seats also work well. Great atmosphere. High ceilings.
We only came for happy hour and snacks but the drinks, atmosphere and staff were amazing. I love the interiors and would definitely visit again.

Great food, great service. Pleasant experience.
Ã‡ok basarili
There is a lot to improve regarding the quality of the food, especially the taste.

Jams was decided as we were in Manhattan hotel and just wanted an amazing start of the day with good brunch !
I randomly picked it and was an ultimate treat ðŸ˜
It is also a hotel and a restaurant . I was lucky to get a reservation on a short notice .
The place is like Amazon forest amazingly decorated and very fancy ðŸ’•

The food was really good . Would highly recommend it
Amazing experience and decent espresso martinis!

The team at JAMS did an absolutely incredible job helping me plan and execute the perfect bridal luncheon!  Andrea was so organized and available helping to develop my plan and reserve the space, the serving team went above and beyond throughout the entire luncheon to keep us on schedule, providing everything we needed, and the lead coordinator Mensa could not have been more attentive, kind and responsive, anticipating anything we needed.  The space is just beautiful, food absolutely delicious and the location, perfect.  I would highly recommend hosting any size of event at JAMS.  You all were wonderful, and my guests loved every minute and morsel!

Great spot close to Central Park and broadway

Service was quick however the food was warmed up rather than free cooked.

Coffee and service was great.
The food was amazing worth the visit

I wandered into Jams on a whim â€” honestly, I only meant to use the bathroom. But the host was so warm and welcoming that I decided to stay for a drink, and Iâ€™m so glad I did.

ðŸ¸ The Drink
I ordered The Greenhouse (about $25), and I can honestly say it was the best cocktail Iâ€™ve ever had in my entire life. Worth every penny. Balanced, vibrant, and crafted with such care â€” the kind of drink that sticks with you long after the last sip.

ðŸ´ The Food & Atmosphere
Although I only stayed for one cocktail, the food menu looked incredible â€” everything passing by to other tables made me want to come back just to eat. The space has a chic, stylish vibe, yet it still feels approachable.

ðŸ¤ The Service
From the moment I walked in, the staff made me feel comfortable and cared for, even though I hadnâ€™t planned to stay. The service felt personal and genuine â€” something you donâ€™t find everywhere in NYC.

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
Jams truly lives up to the hype. Between the welcoming staff, the atmosphere, and that unforgettable cocktail, Iâ€™ll definitely be returning. Highly recommend.
Had the French toast, was so fluffy, sweet and delicious. My friend had the green shashuka and gave me a bite. It was great (Not traditional but so flavorful).
2nd time here in a year. 2nd time as good as the first

This is by no means a Michelin-level restaurant. They brought me a mug for tea that reeks of egg yolk â€” clearly someone drank from it before me and it wasnâ€™t properly washed.

My mood is completely ruined!
Please, gentlemen, at least maintain basic hygiene!
Close walking distance to central park. Had the pancakes and husband had the salmon bagel sandwich. Food was decent, lattes tasted too milky though.
Delicious brunch spot! ðŸ¥—ðŸ¥ž The Jams Kale Salad was fresh and flavorful, and the Buttermilk Pancakes were fluffy and perfectly sweet. Great service and cozy vibe. Highly recommend! â­â­â­â­â­
Great lunch and super atmosphere.

The place atmosphere is adorable with all plants everywhere! Stop by to have a breakfast with kids. However, the menu was so limited, and surprisingly there was no even oats for kids.
Lobster eggs Benedict was a bomb!!!

Go for breakfast. Get the French toast.
You will not regret it. Simply amazing.
Bad place. Luke warm tea, bland french toast, undercooked sausage and my wife's toast was way undergone.  $100 for a lousy breakfast.
Early breakfast w Kiddos before day in Central Park. Very cool place, excellent Service. Food delicious. Prices are adequate for the location ðŸ˜‰
I went to this establishment for a company breakfast and I unfortunately ordered the sausage and I must say it wasn't a good experience. My intestines were rumbling and then......
We has a nice vegetarian breafast andand the french toast that were both prepared well and taste wonderful.
Had a lovely birthday breakfast at Jams. The staff are friendly and attentive. They even brought a birthday muffin and candle out to celebrate, such a sweet gesture.

A bottle of sparkling water costs $15. Need I say more?

Youâ€™re seated at the table, youâ€™re asked if you want still water or sparklingâ€¦
The service was confusing. At first we had two servers all over us and then toward the end we couldnâ€™t find anyone. The food was amazing. Great vibes.
this place is where you would take a hinge first date: ig worthy, aesthetic, and slightly performative. Food good asl tho. Carbonara was great and the monte cristo was nice too
ÐšÑ€Ð°ÑÐ¸Ð²Ð¾Ðµ Ð¼ÐµÑÑ‚Ð¾, Ð²ÐºÑƒÑÐ½Ð°Ñ ÐµÐ´Ð° Ð¸ Ñ…Ð¾Ñ€Ð¾ÑˆÐ¾Ðµ Ð¾Ð±ÑÐ»ÑƒÐ¶Ð¸Ð²Ð°Ð½Ð¸Ðµ
Fantastic breakfast in NYC. The lobster was fantastic. We will come back!
Always visit the 1 Hotel restaurant when you stay (or donâ€™t) because itâ€™s always a great time. Bar, food, ambiance, everything is gravy!
We had a nice breakfast. Everything was very tasty. The portions were quite large.
They were able to get us in on a busy Saturday morning. Clean and spacious. Lovely ambiance

French toast 10/10
Cappucino 8/10
Coconut yogurt parfait 7/10
Croissant 6/10

The establishment presents a pleasant aesthetic; however, the hot breakfast items were served at a cold temperature. Furthermore, there was no follow-up from staff to inquire about the quality of the meal.

The joint is spacious and the atmosphere was great! The staff were quick and attentive.
A bit steep on the pricing but itâ€™s NYC, so I was prepared. The ingredients were mostly fresh, but overall could be better (at least the vegetarian options which is what we had mostly; sourdough was a bit chewy, frittata was dry).
French toast was incredible!!
Would certainly give it another try (probably for lunch or dinner, over brunch). Highly recommend!

For a James beard winner we expected more. Food is ok, nothing blew us away. Service just ok. Wild mushroom frittata a total loser- over salted dry omelette with few mushrooms. Manager was wonderful when we said it

Came for brunch on a Sunday and was greeted by a really lovely atmosphere and such kind staff. Sam was our server and she was so kind and attentive! She also gave great recommendations (I had the french toast and bellini!) The food was really fresh, and well-prepared! My french toast was so decadent, the lemon curd and homemade whipped cream was incredible. I love anything made with vanilla bean, and this whipped cream was some of the best Iâ€™ve tried in a while. Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

High quality food with high quality service, this was an amazing establishment with a great atmosphere and a beautiful greenery type of aesthetic. After a long summer day in New York, this restaurant gave us an escape from the noise and heat of New York City and offered a classy lunch with some of the best service we experienced in the big apple. 10/10 experience.
Si mangia cibo leggero. Il personale Ã¨ disponibilissimo e gentile. Lâ€™ambiente Ã¨ molto carino. Il servizio rapido.
Very nice

All I can say is that I was expecting a pleasant afternoon birthday lunch with one of my closest friends. I love trying new restaurants, but I was honestly disappointed with the service and the food. The hummus was cold, and they gave me the wrong order of food. I didnâ€™t want to be that person to complain, but the service was extremely slow.

Everyone was super friendly and welcoming! I really appreciated assistance from the manager on the floor, who helped me decide on lunch and gave a really excellent drink recommendation. Thanks Mensa! Iâ€™ll be back soon.

Jams is the restaurant of hotel 1, and I guess this gives them some captive clients. The food is presented nicely but was fat, overpriced and several portions were absurdly tiny and/or not tasty. Service was mostly great, except one guy who suddenly appeared while some of us were still eating and began asking if he could take this or that dish, moving his hand over our table and food, it really seemed as if they needed them right now hhh. We will not return.

í˜¸í…” 1ì¸µì— ìžˆëŠ” ë¸ŒëŸ°ì¹˜ ë ˆìŠ¤í† ëž‘ì´ë¼ ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ëŠ” ì¢‹ì€ë° ì•„ì¹¨ ë©”ë‰´ê°€ ë‹¤ì–‘í•˜ì§€ ì•Šê³  ì˜ˆì•½í•´ì•¼ ì´ìš© ê°€ëŠ¥í•´ì„œ walk-inì€ ì•„ì¹¨ ì‹œê°„ëŒ€ì¸ë° ê±°ì ˆí•˜ë”ë¼êµ¬ìš”. ì˜ˆì•½í•˜ê³  ê°€ì„¸ìš”. ë¶„ìœ„ê¸°ëŠ” ë‚˜ì˜ì§€ ì•Šì•„ìš”.

They consistently seat Asian patrons in the far corners, regardless of whether they are tourists or locals, fluent in English or not. Itâ€™s clear that discriminatory practices are at play. Ironically, while service gestures like frequent water refills are performed with the expectation of a tip, the underlying bias remains unmistakable. I encourage those who stand against racial discrimination to reconsider supporting this establishment.

5 stars!

What a charming spot! Perfect for a relaxing weekend breakfast with the family. We ordered the bagel with salmon, pancakes, and brioche French toast. Everything was beautifully prepared and served in generous portions. You can tell thereâ€™s real care put into the food.

The almond croissant was a standout. It was flaky, rich, and packed with real almond flavor. If youâ€™re a true croissant lover, youâ€™ll be in heaven.

The ambiance, both indoors and out, is cozy and welcoming. Highly recommend giving this place a try!

One of my absolute favorite breakfast spots in NYC! Their Greek yogurt with granola is served to perfectionâ€”fresh, creamy, and beautifully balanced. The green juice is equally amazing, refreshing and full of flavor. The natural design of the space, filled with greenery, creates a calm and inviting atmosphere thatâ€™s hard to find in the city. Itâ€™s got such a wonderful ambianceâ€”perfect for a relaxed start to the day. Plus, the location couldnâ€™t be better. Itâ€™s just steps from Central Park, making it the ideal place to enjoy a delicious breakfast before a peaceful walk. I absolutely love it here!

ÐŸÑ€Ð¸ÑÑ‚Ð½Ð¾Ðµ Ð·ÐµÐ»ÐµÐ½Ð¾Ðµ Ð·Ð°Ð²ÐµÐ´ÐµÐ½Ð¸Ðµ Ð´Ð»Ñ Ð±Ñ€Ð°Ð½Ñ‡Ð°. Ð•Ð´Ð° Ð²ÐºÑƒÑÐ½Ð°Ñ. Ð’ Ð²Ñ‹Ñ…Ð¾Ð´Ð½Ñ‹Ðµ Ð·Ð´ÐµÑÑŒ ÑˆÑƒÐ¼Ð½Ð¾Ð²Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾. ÐÐµÐ¼Ð½Ð¾Ð³Ð¾ ÑÑ‚Ñ€Ð°Ð½Ð½Ð°Ñ Ð¿Ð¾Ð´Ð°Ñ‡Ð° ÑÑ‚ÐµÐ¹ÐºÐ° Ñ ÑÐ¹Ñ†Ð°Ð¼Ð¸, Ñ‚Ð°Ðº Ð¸ Ñ…Ð¾Ñ‡ÐµÑ‚ÑÑ Ð½ÐµÐ¿Ñ€Ð¸Ð»Ð¸Ñ‡Ð½Ð¾ Ð¿Ð¾ÑˆÑƒÑ‚Ð¸Ñ‚ÑŒðŸ™ˆ
Ð˜Ð· Ð¼Ð¸Ð½ÑƒÑÐ¾Ð² - Ð¾Ð´Ð¸Ð½ Ñ‚ÑƒÐ°Ð»ÐµÑ‚ Ð½Ð° Ð¿ÐµÑ€Ð²Ð¾Ð¼ ÑÑ‚Ð°Ð¶Ðµ Ð´Ð»Ñ Ð´Ð¾ÑÑ‚Ð°Ñ‚Ð¾Ñ‡Ð½Ð¾ Ð±Ð¾Ð»ÑŒÑˆÐ¾Ð³Ð¾ Ð·Ð°Ð»Ð° Ð¸ Ð½Ðµ Ð¾Ñ‡ÐµÐ½ÑŒ Ñ‡Ð¸ÑÑ‚Ñ‹Ð¹.
Good location, love the greenery inside and outside the restaurant. Food was good, not amazing. Service was better than other places Iâ€™ve been to in NY.

Had a great brunch at Jams! We tried the Salmon Everything Bagel, Brioche French Toast, and Greek Yogurt Parfait, along with some coffee. The salmon bagel was packed with toppings, which was a big plus. The parfait was fresh and delicious. The French toast was a huge portionâ€”definitely filling!

The ambiance was really nice, and the interior design gives off that laid-back Californian vibe, which I loved. Overall, a great spot for brunch, and Iâ€™d definitely go back for dinner!

We planned a fun brunch with a larger group of friends to celebrate a birthday and had an excellent time! Their staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Their food is delicious, as are their coffees and drinks. They serve an organic menu which adds to the freshness of their food. Highly recommend the brioche French toast with strawberry and lemon curd (pictured). Also the atmosphere is cozy and inviting with all the plants.

Nice place near Central Park that offers delicious food. We were there for lunch and as usually I tasted the burger ðŸ”. It was nice, but it didnâ€™t impress me. Having in mind that it was 20-30% more expensive than the burgers in Manhattan it wasnâ€™t special enough. We tried few more things that were also nice but I didnâ€™t find them special.
So good. This place has a wonderful atmosphere and delicious food. Everything we got was yummy and the service was lovely. Little pricey and best to have a reservation, but worth it!

Jams at 1 Hotel has all the makings of a great brunch spotâ€”beautiful ambiance, a cozy setting, and a menu that feels promising. However, for a higher-end hotel, the food itself is pretty average.

That said, their menu is quite unique - we opted for the vegan peanut butter oatmeal, botanical breakfast and side of chicken sausage. Truly, their peanut butter chocolate oatmeal is absolutely TO DIE FORâ€”rich, comforting, and worth a return visit just for that alone. Everything else was decent but nothing particularly standout.

Since table space in NYC is quite limited, we opted to sit at the bar, which ended up being a great choice. The bar has a beautiful counter, and the plus side is that you can order food there as wellâ€”a nice perk if you prefer a more relaxed experience.

Service-wise, our experience was mixed. The host was not friendly or accommodating, coming across as standoffish and uninterested. Fortunately, our server was fantasticâ€”attentive, fast, and kind, which made a huge difference.

On a super cold east coast morning, stepping into a warm, inviting space for a cozy brunch was exactly what I needed to fuel up for the workday. While the food overall doesnâ€™t necessarily match the upscale setting, the oatmeal alone is enough for me to return.

First time at Jams and will def be back.
Met up with friend for quick brunch. I ordered English breakfast tea and Chia pudding, friend had French Toast and it was so good that I didn't get a pic. My chin pudding was refreshing, good consistency and tasty.
Our server, didn't get his name, was courteous, friendly and very pleasant. He was patient with us and made us feel welcomed.

JAMS offers an impeccable ambiance that perfectly complements its sumptuous food. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, making it a great place to enjoy a delicious and well-prepared meal. A fantastic dining experience all around!

Great place and ambiance! The good was good, but overpriced. Maybe itâ€™s a standard now in NYC. The host forgot our Capoucino and had to be reminded again. SAME thing with the bill. Overall, too expensive for me to go back.

My friend and I finally decided to try out this place we often pass by. We made a reservation and were excited to see if it lived up to our curiosity. Unfortunately, the food turned out to be just mediocre.

We ordered the fries and lobster Benedict. The fries were overly salty and not the style we usually enjoy. As for the lobster Benedict, it was underwhelming. The flavor felt like it was missing something, and it didnâ€™t offer any surprises.

On the positive side, the atmosphere was great, making it a convenient spot for a casual meet-up. The servers were okay, providing standard service without much to note.

Overall, while the food didnâ€™t impress us, the ambiance and convenience might make it worth another visit for a simple get-together. However, if youâ€™re looking for exceptional flavors, this might not be the place.

I had a wonderful dining experience at Jams in the 1 Hotel Central Park. I ordered the cavatelli with tomato sauce, and it was absolutely deliciousâ€”perfectly cooked and full of flavor. The atmosphere is warm and inviting, with a beautifully designed space that feels both stylish and cozy. I especially love the dÃ©cor and the abundance of plants, which add a fresh and natural touch. The staff was incredibly welcoming and attentive, making the whole experience even better. Definitely a place Iâ€™d love to return to!
I randomly saw this place during a walk and decided to book a table because of the Michellin â­ï¸. The menu was not big, but the food was delicious, still nothing super out of the ordinary
Tried several dishes from their dinner menu and they did not disappoint! Great service and ambiance as well. Will definitely come back to try their breakfast menu.

This is a really cute places for brunch! It was very busy, but the restaurant is spacious. Our server was attentive and polite and the food was good with hardly any wait at all. It's a little pricey for what it is, but this is New York... It was worth it for the ambience! Recommended!
We had Sam as our server this morning, and she was lovely and attentive. The food was excellent, hot, and quick to come out of the kitchen. The atmosphere was great. I love the Green shakshuka!

Starting off I have to mention Jacqueline and Monsur, the service was honestly above and beyond. They were so attentive and anticipated every need- I havenâ€™t had service like this in months. The food was very tasty and the selections were excellent- recommend the barata, gnocchi and the steak was incredibly tender and tasty. The 1 hotel is always good to me but this is one of the best places in New York for a comfortable and gourmet dinner. Will be back

Great place for brunch. It sits inside 1 Hotel but I think also has its own entrance. It has a nice atmosphere with all the plants and is an aesthetically pleasing space. The food is good enough where I would probably come back here with friends if I need a brunch spot. If you are in the area in need of a brunch place I would say this place should be in your consideration set!

I liked the avocado toast. The side of potatoes which is not pictured below was outstanding and the pancakes were absolutely delicious if you are craving something sweet. The katsu sandwich looked tasty. The eggs Benedict was a bit on the small side.

We ate here on our last night in New York. I only wish we had found this restaurant earlier in our trip as we had a great time. The food was excellent, the atmosphere was lively and our server looked after us well.

It took awhile for the host to get to us, but we were able to easily get seated when she did. The service was okay, as was the food. I didnâ€™t think the food or drinks were anything special. The prices were very high and you definitely did not get good quality food for it. The place itself is cute though, good atmosphere.

My son and I stopped by here for lunch right after our visit at the MoMa nearby. Jacqueline was our server and we received exceptional service! I appreciate her patience she had with my energetic toddler and her welcoming demeanor. She checked in on us throughout our meal and was very friendly. The food was delicious and will definitely come back for the relaxing vibe and atmosphere. One of the better restaurants I've been to in Midtown. Highly recommend!

I had my first visit to Jamâ€™s Restaurant at the 1 Hotel, and I was genuinely impressed. The ambiance was beautiful with its lush greenery and peaceful, zen-like vibeâ€”it didnâ€™t even feel like I was in Manhattan. We were celebrating my step-popâ€™s birthday, and everything from the food to the service was excellent. I had a burger, my son had the cheeseburger, and I also tried a bit of everything on the tableâ€”nothing disappointed. I had a few gin cocktails that were amazing, even if I canâ€™t remember their names! A big thank you to Jackie, who was super attentive and helped us through the menu. Iâ€™ll definitely be back.

Had an amazing summer salad for lunch, so good came back for an equally amazing dinner with an especially good roast chicken and a peach and plum salad. The cheese plate was much better than most. Service was excellent. Restaurant is full of plants which was very pleasant. Only disappointment was a tasteless tuna crudo which seemed to have none of the seasonings listed in the menu item.

Second visit the salad was not nearly as good and the chicken was dry and tasteless.

Third visit the salad was terrible and the chicken was only slightly better than the time before. Sadly this will be my last visit
Great bar and restaurant in 1 Hotel near Central Park. Beautiful and trendy. Pricey for sure but the drinks were top notch. 1 Hotel is beautiful. Go check it out, Tell em Barsnobs sent ya!

To celebrate a friendâ€™s promotion, we decided to dine at Jams, and it was an excellent choice! The atmosphere was vibrant yet cozy, creating the perfect setting for a memorable night. The service was top-notch, with every staff member attentive and welcoming.

One of the standout moments was when Egypt, the manager, personally came over to check on us. Her personable nature made us feel like VIPs. To our surprise, Chef Carinna also made an appearance at our table to greet us, which added a special touch to the experience.

The music was another highlight of the evening, with the DJ playing a fantastic mix that set the mood without overpowering the conversation. It added to the overall energy and made the night feel like a true celebration.

Overall, Jams exceeded our expectations in every way, from the warm and personable service to the lively ambiance. I highly recommend it for any special occasion or just a night out with great vibes!
Lovely meal in a plant-filled room. The DJ is a little too loud at 6:30 pm, but well meaning. One of our party recommended the chicken and it was delicious. Would recommend this place near 57th St.

Jams at The 1 Hotel is a gem. I fell in love with the space during brunchâ€”modern rustic vibes, floor-to-ceiling windows, and all the greenery that draws the eye up to ceilings. The cocktails are fresh and delicious, and the food is just as memorable. Returned for dinner with my family and the experience was just as specialâ€”warm, candlelit ambiance, perfect service from Sam, and thoughtful recommendations from Jackie, the manager who also shared her love for the plants. Everything was on point. Whether for a full meal or just a drink at the bar, I always recommend Jams and canâ€™t wait to go back.

Brunch was good, not the most exciting menu but still worth it. The vibe is excellent, like a coffee shop vibe but inside a swanky hotel. Being near Central Park is obviously a great perk, eat a good meal >> go for a walk. Sunday brunch isâ€¦
